Even with all the required skills, it can still take a lot of time to build a complex scene.

bio: Owner, founder & CEO of Decentraland’s first & biggest realtor “DCLRealEstate.org”. My background is “Finance & Economics” in the real world, where i am soon a Real Estate Agent. Been in Decentraland since october 2021, and kickstarted the land-rental business in DCL with my realtor agency.
relevant_skills: Leadership & in general a trusted advisor for new users in Decentraland, who look to invest into land or rent it.
involvement: I’ve been involved with DCL since october 2021. My company DCL Real Estate manages 10+ active rentals and properties, and we rent, sell and advise lands for clients. We have sold/rented over 30+ properties/lands in DCL since our foundation, and had 60+ video meetings and written over 1000+ discord messages with users who wanted to learn more about Decentraland and onboarded them into understanding the land market, Decentraland and in general Web3. We’re the leading DCL Expert in the land-market and have a active user-base of 900+ members in our land-focused discord where we love digital real estate. We contribute with helping people get started in the metaverse, as well with giving income to land owners with selling & leasing out their properties, aswell with giving new users buyer & rental advise.
motivation: First of all I love real estate - so im loving Decentraland, it’s community and the way it’s controlled. I LOVE Decentraland, but we need to improve it so we can keep being the BEST metaverse in the world in the crypto space, it’s the most important for me. DCL needs more positive changes and we need the DAO to stop being so careful and we need to accepting more projects and innovative ideas to improve = better game & more active daily users. Way too much land is empty, and i am ready to do my part as Decentraland’s leading realtor, investor and delegate candidate to make sure we create the best Decentraland as possible. I am ready to be your voice in Decentraland and work for the land-owners & new users best interest, and be your best voice possible. We need it to be easier for outside businesses and users to join us! We can do it, yes we can!
vision: First of all, no more lag & bugs. Fixing basic visual issues and allowing more projects and businesses to generate user activity to the land & content is our number one issue in DCL. I see so much potential with this technology and the community for making Decentraland the first choise of real life businesses and users to join us. We need to make it attractive and easy to access, as a “noob” in the web3 space, with fun games and NFT shops, cinemas and clubs, so business will thrive. In 5 years i see all big brands in the international world be a part of the metaverse with their own nft’s and shops. If we manage to make great partnerships we will be the number one choise.
most_important_issue: Scene creation, wearables and renting land needs to be EASIER. This is a MUST. We need to continue our development and be better at marketing.

bio: Wearable creator, Owner/Founder/Designer of KAZUTO (my wearable shoe brand in DCL), member of Year2Thousand design group, metaverse lover.
involvement: I have been a part of Decentraland since September 2020 and have watched it develop to what it is today. I started creating wearables in March 2022. Also started helping organizing events for the community around Metaverse Fashion Week. Hosting events for my shoe releases as well.
motivation: Right now my main concern is the growth of Decentraland. I want to contribute to the DAO in ways that help the community and platform continually grow, and continue bringing new ways to further engage people and bring them into the Decentraland platform. I’ve been active in the DAO and also active with trying to teach my little community about the DAO.
vision: I see Decentraland being one of the main pillars in what we consider the metaverse in 5 years. The fully decentralized platform is groundbreaking, and I think it will be the ultimate success for Decentraland in the coming years. No other platform is going that route, which brings it’s own excitement for anyone wanting to be apart of the platform and add their own creativity or their own voice. This will be a platform you can come to and build whatever you can think of.
most_important_issue: I think the most important issue in Decentraland right now is growth and sustainability. As long as we can keep new things coming to the platform, that engages our community and draws new people in while the market is down will be key to the platform having an upper hand when the Metaverse hype comes back full force.

bio: Im a crypto and metaverse enthusiast. I served in the United States Marine Corps as a Light Armored Recon Marine 03-11 03-13. I think this tech will & can change lives.It can prevent loss of life & change the world for the best.
involvement: I have enjoyed running around exploring decentraland. Meeting other people and crypto enthusiast. I believe we are at the forefront of a new frontier. I have onboarded people in the past and hope to continue to do so.I have made a couple tutorials and event videos. Ive hired community creators to publish my own designs. Ive owned and built on land in the past. Im very eyes on and vocal in the dao. Im not a yes man or a paid shill. I try to learn and know who is who and what they have done. To look at the bigger picture and see different sides. DCL is not a profit scheme for me. My involvement is more as a user and engager then business or developer. I spent months running around wonderzone and the world before I linked a wallet and jumped full in. Think my profile will say Dec 7, '2021. Id say probably 4-6 months before that if not longer. I do remember watching news in 2017 or maybe 18 about the land sales and early days. However I just never had the economic ability at the time to land grab or jump full in. I was getting into coins and still learning. To this date ive given away a couple thousand wearables for free to try and draw in new faces and keep old. Ive documented events in this space on youtube and made tutorials. I remain active and try to walk in many communities.
motivation: To be honest I dont, but I think we need people who are watching and paying attention. We need people who are asking questions about why we need this. Do we need this and what does it do for Decentraland as a whole. I think the more diversified the dao and the vote power the more we have a thriving community. One that isnt a echo chamber or one sided. I think there is a lot of people who come here trying to get money and just run. Its kinda unethical and not at all beneficial to DCL as a whole. I want to see DCL thrive through development from the community and its ideas and the foundation itself. Its important to me that we dont gate keep. At the same time we cannot allow corruption, collusion and unaccountability stifle innovation and engagement.
vision: Id like to see Growth in user base, Experiences and engagment. Id like to see people use DAO funds for things that create immersive player experiences. This is what will separate us from the upcoming crypto gaming and metaverse boom. The build it and they will come approach. Id like to see us continue to develop and innovate. Add ability to trade wearables in game. Maybe even resources in built games. Ability to use emojis in chat. Id like to see us revisit smart wearables at some point. Maybe add player vehicles instead of just skins. Make it easier for people to build. Easier access or ability to stream or host music on parcel without the high learning curve. Larger parcel limits and size. Vr integration and connection to other metaverses through immersion. Thats probably further off tho.
most_important_issue: Lack of deployment on land. Lack of multi cultural content. Names in different language text. I think there are people who see people get money in the dao and not deliver and it discourages them from investing further into the platform. Also think people are noticing the same groups get funds and there is a lack of different people able to make something of them selves. They end up not wanting to be a part of the community. I think building on your land is intimidating to new users. Personally I think the current limitations are steep for a lot of people for what they pay. I think that also drives away very talented creators and individuals. I believe new players get overwhelmed and we need more not influencers but people educating and helping new comers out. In the months to come I believe other metaverses may pop up and follow suit with many of decentralands current issues. If they can however make building, streaming and content delivery easier they may draw more users. Some people will probably multi metaverse, but we could see a outflux of current user or new users we acquire. As of the time of writing this we are 8 to 9 months in a down trend. If we face another so called crypto winter we could see many people exit on that alone. I can also see if we do not support or enable current builders and content creators they may abandon this platform and take their skills else where.

bio: Hey everyone, my name is Sean AKA FriskyBumbleBee, and I have been involved within Decentraland since 01/2022. I am 9-year army veteran, consultant, twitch streamer, Decentraland Reporter, and owner of Future Investment Group (FIG) LLC. I have been involved with numerous activities in Decentraland and collaborated with a individuals and organizations to create wearables.
involvement: I have first entered this space in January 2022 and have been active within the community for over 7 months. I have been involved with many events, attended many shows, and have supporting different organizations as well as artists and creators within this space. The following are a few of the achievements and venues I supported: Attended the MetaParty Fashion Week as a content creator in March. Collaborated with individuals to publish wearables. Became a reporter for the “The Decentraland Report (May 2022) and have been actively engaged in covering content from events, to interviews with members of this space. Voted on previous DAO proposals. Create unique posts on social media (Twitter, Tiktok, and YouTube). Purchased many wearable creators by purchasing their wearables, promoting their giveaways / updates, and
motivation: I have about 2100 VP (1 Parcel, and name claim) in which I leverage to support new ideas and DAO proposals. However, I would like to have more because I can use my experience from the military and consulting to investigate the DAO proposals from a business perspective. Many subcontracts in the past I have worked with IRL, had proposed their deliverables in the scope of work. I also had many incidents where a scope of work was not clearly defined, in which resulted in a loss of financial and poor-quality deliverables. Leveraging my project management background as a consultant, I possess the abilities to properly assess a proposal by identifying crucial gaps and vulnerabilities, especially if the work breakdown structure is not clearly defined. My having VP delegated to myself, I can ensure the proposals are well documented, and provide an unbiased view from a business perspective and DCL stakeholders will be properly represented.
vision: I foresee Decentraland being the premier metaverse, and many of the builders within this space are ensuring this vision is being well achieved. It will scale further with even more active users. Although, many other competitors are trying to build new metaverses, Decentraland- will always be the premier hub in terms of metaverses. The number of builders and leaders within this community is unrivaled. I also would like to show military representation within this space. Many veterans, and even soldiers who are deployed to various parts of the globe, can still have connectivity, and have the social interaction that zoom, face time cannot achieve. My ultimate 5-year vision for Decentraland is having more large organizations and brands entering Decentraland, because of the quality community members, potential outreach to people across the whole globe, and leveraging the pioneers who have been supporting this space as subject matter experts. In doing so, members who have been in this space may bolster their career as a consultant or technical subject matter expert and work side by side with vast organizations. As for activity, in the past 6 months I have been in this space, I have seen pioneers such as MetaParty, DiceMasters, Babydolls and many other organizations really pushing the boundaries to provide a unique end user experience. I foresee many organizations within this space leveraging this skill set in providing amazing gaming, gallery, and event experience for individuals.
most_important_issue: One of the biggest issues I have seen during my tenure in Decentraland is retention and scaling the platform. Retention is quintessential because we need to have many quality users not logging on once and then leave, but to continue logging on and being part of the community. Much feedback I received from the community was “there was nothing to do.“ However, many organizations have down a spectacular job in creating a one-of-a-kind end user experience such as MetaParty with their battle 2 earn system, and DiceMasters with their incredible RPG developed, and BVERSE with their networking and fireside twitter spaces. I think as time progresses, there will be even more organizations creating new experiences for individuals to participate in. The last issue I have seen is up-scaling and marketing. Many organizations and even media outlets have attempted to cover topics on Decentraland and the metaverse in general, but fails to provide an extraordinary message to the possibilities within this space. Many social media platforms such as TikTok, LinkedIn, and reddit are untapped platforms that can provide amazing content in what Decentraland is, the benefits in this space, and ultimately exposure for Decentraland to upscale and attract quality users. Thank you for your time and consideration, and I hope I can be the spearhead in some of these changes with VP delegated to myself.

bio: Hello, I’m Mr. Dhingia! I am a builder here in Decentraland since November 2021. Since then, I have designed 20+ custom builds for various projects and individuals. I have a club in Decentraland and have hosted various events. I also stay engaged in the community through supporting many events.
involvement: I have been involved in Decentraland since November 2021. As stated above, I have worked with various individuals and projects in Decentraland to design custom builds. I have gifted a few of my builds to individuals who are contributing to the community. In my earlier DCL days, I helped many individuals with social media graphics, banners and videos, helping them launch and market their brands. I also help provide meaningful, ad-hoc feedback where I can and as I experience or come across many builds. For example, I have provided build feedback to users I come across at their parcel (i.e. collider issues, spawn locations, better use of materials/space). Additionally, I hosted multiple events at the Dhingia Club (144,-148) including an event for the Brazilian Community, and wearable launch parties. I have been actively engaging in the Decentraland community including attending events, providing wearables to the Decentraland Twitch Streamers for giveaways, attending Twitter Spaces, engaging in multiple Discord servers, and assisting with 3D modeling/design advice. I also provided a space for the Decentraland creator community to create videos/photos with a green screen near my club and has served many individuals so far. I have also created various content on my social media to help bring awareness to Decentraland.
motivation: I would like to contribute to the DAO to help support individuals and projects with unique ideas that will bring more creativity into Decentraland or projects that will improve the user experience. I also want to help ensure that DAO funds are being properly distributed to individuals within the grant proposals with a reputable track record, and individuals active in Decentraland. It is also important that these grant recipients stay active and continue to build before, during, and after their proposal is granted. Since I have designed multiple builds,I am able to have an understanding of the scope of work mentioned in these builder-related grants. I also want to help bring more diversity to Decentraland and ensure that a diverse mix of grant types are being properly passed (i.e. content creation, improvements to SDK, data analysis, etc). It is important that the right ideas are being brought into Decentraland, but also important to analyze whether enough funds have already been distributed to a “type” of idea already.
vision: My personal goal here in Decentraland as a 3D builder is to design as many builds/active scenes which bring value and retain users in Decentraland. I want to see more land parcels be developed so users don’t see empty parcels. An ideal Decentraland would be to see as minimal grass as possible. I want to help provide my services to dedicated creators/individuals currently active or coming into the space bringing value. I see the value of retaining our most creative users and want to help keep Decentraland growing through their work. In terms of Decentraland, I would love to see millions of active users engaging in the space, but also having a great user experience via unique events, games, and other experiences. This includes ensuring more users are able to access the space (i.e. mobile, desktop, VR), but making sure these experiences are flawless (minimal server issues, computer lag or audio issues, etc). So far, I love seeing how global Decentraland has become, connecting people from multiple countries in the world. I want to see more countries and more communities evolve in this space as a way to express their ideas, culture, and thoughts. For example, I am based in India and would love to see more of my community here.
most_important_issue: To me, marketing Decentraland is one of the most important factors and an issue currently. I want to see more advertisements of what Decentraland is, what events are here, what brands are coming in on various social platforms or mediums (i.e. Web2 Social Media, newspapers, TV ads, radio shows, web3 platforms, etc), as this is important to show users what is being done here. I feel like Decentraland has built an amazing portfolio of brands, builds, and unique experiences that have not been fully marketed to its potential. I also want to see more presence in future conferences surrounding emerging tech, Web3, metaverse, and VR. Ultimately, the goal is to get more users aware of the metaverse, but also be provided with the most resources to be educated about utilizing the platform. With Decentraland being backed by MANA, it is important to educate non-crypto users how the platform works with cryptocurrency. Additionally, educating those who may not fully understand the capabilities and importance of the metaverse in the current digital age. In the coming months, more metaverses are going to be created, which will increase competition for Decentraland. We, as a platform, will have to make our best efforts to keep users engaged and retained in Decentraland through many experiences/IT innovations/ smooth DCL functionality. Interoperability will also be a huge factor and how we communicate/network with other metaverses to bring more communities to Decentraland.

bio: I’ve been in Decentraland for about 2 years, I am largely involved in the development of Decentraland, and I sometimes will help new builders as much as possible in the discord channel. I also started Meta Live Studio back at the start of 2020. Most of our works were done in Decentraland, our most unique work is MetaGamiMall, a future metaverse mall in Decentraland.
involvement: I spent nearly most of my time on Decentraland. I kept building things and holding events in Decentralnad. Feel free to check our work, especially MetaGamiMall, 146,60. Also, I kept providing help for the modelling-type developer and want to do more in the future as I believe there will be more need on this side, and there is not enough support for them.
motivation: I have a decent understanding of Decentraland as a project, and I got those experience from building and exploring thus I believe I can provide some useful opinions regards to DAO proposals, and I am willing to get more engaged with the community.
vision: Personally, I think Decentraland will be one of the biggest WEB3 metaverses in 5 years. And it has a great potential to be the biggest one. It will have exciting activities all the time, lots of traffic of course, and a place to celebrate the spirit of Decentralisation. And DAO is one of the biggest factors in how Decentraland can be Decentralised. DAO will be the future form of decision-making group, all for the future of Decentraland. Also, it’s a way for everyone who speaks their voice. Of course, you need to do something to make your voice loud, but at least everyone can speak about their idea equally. And this leads to a better form of community, collective decision making, and collective building.
most_important_issue: I see 3 evident issues for now. First, the threshold for development is too high as one of the biggest metaverse in web3. If we cannot let everyone can create things, then the project cannot expand on a great scale. The good news is DCL team is aware of this and wants to change this with the help of SDK7. Second, the total experience of DCL is not quite ideal, from the webpage design to the world laggy issue, we need to make DCL more professional, and luckily, DCL is aware of this issue as well and started to change it. Third, the DAO needs a better form of rules and ways to execute the rules. Now that we can see DAO is working, but we all know there are too many things to improve here, i,e the centralisation of votes and media rights in a small group of people’s hands, and sometimes, I would smell politics here. However, I think it will have a good future and really looking forward to it.

bio: My name is Szilard Janko (SzJanko), I am a professional underwater photo and videographer. Have been involved with blockchain tech since 2017, also minted my first NFT in 2017 and was part of DCL since the original land sales. Currently, I am building The Ocean Meta to onboard the ocean community into the metaverse.
relevant_skills: -Photography and videography (with featured work on Discovery Channels Shark Week, National Geographic, and many other publications)
involvement: I have been involved with Decentraland since the initial land sale (the Terraform Event back in 2017). I invested in both land and the museum district. Originally I had a gallery built on my original land that I bought during the auction. Since then we have moved the gallery to my brothers land, where we are using it to build The Ocean Meta project. Our current goal with The Ocean Meta project is to onboard the ocean community to Decentraland, everything from the underwater world to surfing. We have a combined following between The Ocean Meta team of over 190,000 people that are interested in ocean related content. We plan to start onboarding these people once Instagram rolls out the full NFT features it has planned with Ethereum and Polygon integration. Until that time, we are focusing on building and contributing to Decentralands development. I have personally invested in multiple projects in Decentraland and with The Ocean Meta project, we have been showcasing ocean related art, have used it to host ocean themed gallery and educational learn 2 earn events, with many future events coming. Along with multiple collaborating events with Decentral Games, Snarky Sharkz, Dice Masters, B-Verse, Vroomway and other DCL projects.
motivation: I want to contribute more time to helping the development of Decentraland by participating in governance and proposal discussions. I want to see Decentraland stay in the lead of other metaverse projects, both because I am building my project, The Ocean Meta, here and because Decentraland offers a truly decentralized version of the metaverse vision. I think it is very important that we ensure that the decentralized metaverse is the one that will gain mainstream adoption. Having 5+ years of experience in investing and researching in the cryptocurrency/blockchain field, I think I have gained valuable knowledge that will help with Decentralands governance and proposal discussions/votes.
vision: My 5 year vision for Decentraland is to see it grow into the main metaverse platform that hosts a variety of content, from gaming, entertainment and educational builds. To see it become interoperable with multiple other metaverse platforms, both with decentralized and with private/centralized built platform. Allow users to move seamlessly with one account between all of these worlds. This also includes a web, client, and VR version of Decentralized that is capable of running high graphics, with low lag, and the ability to handles hundreds-of-thousands of users at a time.
most_important_issue: The most important issue for Decentraland is to create a feature rich base layer that makes it both easy and highly customizable for developers to build to the limits of their imagination. This base layer has to remain decentralized and open to multiple metaverses to eventually become interoperable with Decentraland. By creating a platform that opens up the limits of what is possible to be built here, it will attract the developers needed to create amazing gaming, entertainment and educational experiences here. The users / mainstream will come, once the platform is ready.

bio: My name is Luke, I’m 29, and I live in the US, but I go by ile on discord and twitter. My expertise is in architectural and 3D spatial design. I lead the Varc (virtual architecture) District and am doing ongoing research into how organizing Land with channels allows users to get more use out of their Land.
involvement: I’ve been involved with Decentraland since 2017 before the ICO and land auctions. I originally posted the idea for an architecture district on github and five other individuals agreed and contributed Land to the 19 parcel Varc District. Today I am the only fully active member of the district and use the land for experiments with the SDK and architectural form. I recently graduated with my masters in architecture where I did thesis research on the benefits of using channels to organize space in decentraland (see link above). Basically, channels allow landowners to take full advantage of their parcel’s square footage and polygon budget by reusing both infinitely. Also using channels to organize space informs a new style or architecture that is novel and unique and goes beyond copying IRL architectural tradition and form. I check DCL discords regularly, answer questions about building and workflow when I can, and try to experiment with the SDK and building new scenes daily. I’m fairly active in the DAO and generally support proposals having to do with content creation or improving the platform and governance system.
motivation: This application is in response to recent discussion on VP distribution and whale votes. I think our voting system needs to evolve beyond Mana = VP in the long term, but the best short term counter to whale power is an active and passionate coalition of voters with VP.
vision: This might be unfeasible or incompatible with how DCL is set up, but I see Decentraland evolving into a world of worlds. Where Genesis city becomes sort of a directory and each parcel of Land is a gate/link to privately hosted decentraland environments similar to how realms work today.
most_important_issue: I think one of the largest problems with Decentraland is its barrier of entry and accessibility. I worry that as other metaverse platforms mature, many new users will overlook Decentraland because it is too expensive and decide to use other more centralized platforms because they are free to build in. I’d like to see some sort of Freemium model for new users in Decentraland where every avatar is automatically given an out of world tutorial scene that they can experiment with and invite people to before buying Land in Genesis City. Another large issue with the platform is its lack of methods of interaction between avatars. Right now users can’t really do more than text or voice chat in world. I’d like to see functions like trading NFT’s, delegating VP, delegating Land operator rights, and voting in the DAO, all become actions avatars can easily do in world. This, I think, will move a lot of community activity off of 2D apps like the DAO page, discord, and the marketplace, and into Decentraland.

bio: I write for magazines about Decentraland and digital fashion. I do a weekly newsletter around it, DCL Wearables Daily.
involvement: I joined Decentraland in February. Since then, I have started my weekly newsletter about the platform and its creators. In addition, I interview Decentraland people for such publications as Hackernoon, NFTPlazas, etc. I occasionally do Twitter space and interview creators live. I plan to contribute to more web2 and web3 magazines to write about the platform and its citizens.
motivation: I would love to be involved more in platform growth. I can bring my writing and publishing skills to help projects get their messages out there more simply and understandably. I also have my own online magazine (find it in my links), so I have experience creating content that can reach people without paid marketing. And have worked with top media outlets where I earned my media articles without paid promotions (Forbes, Guardian, TechRadar, you name it).
vision: I want to see Decentraland in more clear and simple light communication-wise. There are so many great things that people don’t know about at the moment because it’s hard to find or gather all information. I believe Decentraland will scale its content and messaging in more detailedly: every great event deserves the spotlight in the media. And I do believe that DAO must help creators who will carry that flag.
most_important_issue: Without the technical details, I think the biggest challenge is gathering information all over the place. As a writer, I gather information from all over the place: chats, Twitter, newsletters, Discord, etc. It’s messy and not reliable and often very complicated to read. The media don’t get the chance to be the first to know what will happen next in Decentraland. The media wants to be the first to write about it, and it’s usually too late for the story when the party is tomorrow.

bio: I am Potradamus I have resided in Decentraland since June, 2021. I spend an average, roughly around, 8-16 Hours per day and participate in a majority of the events and games within this space. I have promoted or sponsored events for Gallery187 and enjoy exploring Decentraland.
relevant_skills: Senior Systems Network Engineer A+,Net+,Net+Linux, MCP, MCSE, CCNA, CCNP
involvement: I am Holy Ones, Meta trekkers, TRU, Sugar club NFT holder. Games I participate in on a regular basis is WildernessP2E, Wonder Zone, Ice Poker, Dice Masters, Vroomway, and many of the parkours to name a few. I consider myself more of a community supporter then anything else and try my best to attend events and support as many artists and creators i can. I vote in the DAO regularly and try to participate as much as possible I believe this makes me a good candidate for VP.
motivation: I would like to have a bigger role in the shaping of DCL modeled in the Web3 space in the metaverse. This includes real decentralization, democratic voting, and a platform built by Web3 creators above the old models built around Web2. To help in the funding of promoting creators and builders for helping in the on-boarding of new daily users.
vision: I would like to see a fun and safe place for users, along with builders and creators, help to mold and evolve a metaverse where everyone is accepted, and opportunities for equality and monetization becomes a reality in the ever growing Web3 space.
most_important_issue: I personally think how the voting and who can participate, along with hidden votes should be a priority for the long term. In the short term I would just like to see a more robust and stable environment and the UI being a strong selling point to persuade and on-board new users.

bio: Psychologist by education, 23 years of experience in advertising agencies/ brand and communication strategies. Always close to NGO’s, social communication, believing communication can improve people’s lives.
involvement: Online since Feb 22, a heavy user and follower, natural DCL evangelist, MANA maximalist, Forum member, DAO voter
motivation: I want to promote more involvement, discussion (drive engagement and understanding before rejection) and listening.
vision: The go-to place for free time with friends and discovery. With today’s entry price (LAND) - it will have to be sponsored is some way. DCL is the place for branded entertainment and creator economy.
most_important_issue: UX. Cross platform is harder than cross-chain - using DCL.exe is still a challenge an a huge area for improvement Adoption. Driving adoption is crucial. This will be driven by gameplay (making DCL more CPU-friendly), and marketing partnerships (it’s still the Web2 that drives Web3)

bio: Hello, My name is kevin and i go by Peterparker in the metaverse. I am interested in teaching people about this space and how to progress here and start building connections.
relevant_skills: Great community member based on real values, I will support ideas and proposals based on the merit of the value the will produce and what they will bring to the entire DCL community
involvement: I am very active in the space, I stream content and have given over 1000 wearables away. I would say I have over 4000 plus hours in game and appreciate the wide range of style, creativity and hard work the community put into there spaces! The great things DCL does as far as events is not comparable to other web3 games! its a great experience to be able to put time and effort and actually earn and be a part of it all! Now I have the DCL name PeterparkerWeb3.
motivation: I feel like I am a great person who will stand for DCL as a true member that cares about the entire game progression, I only want great things for everyone in this space!
vision: I see DCL being on top of the web3 space and similar to a virtual facebook where people come to interact with friends and share experiences like playing games together, watching movies or music shows and meeting awesome people across the globe.
most_important_issue: Have a fair and balanced DAO that is based with active players that actually use the content provided so the game and space can grow.

bio: I enjoy metatrekking across the metaverse meeting new people and exploring new civilizations. I co-host an art showcase event on Twitter Spaces and in Decentraland. I enjoy hearing how artists create and the inspirations behind them. I am in the U.S. and old enough to know better, not set in my ways, and open to hearing different perspectives.
relevant_skills: I have been on a #DAO board for a small gaming token on the WAX blockchain which lead to much research on how they work. I vote on #governance proposals on multiple #blockchains. OSMOSIS, STARZ, EVMOS, WAX, EOS, MATIC, HIVE. I’ve challenged my self to learn creating #NFTs and have made a few small collections. I am looking to learn #Blender and possibly some #coding. Used #Canva to design my first #community-wearables
involvement: I have only been in Decentraland a short time. Officially since around May 2022. I co-host and art showcase event at -69, 139 and have had the pleasure to speak with many talented creators. I have hosted Twitter Spaces for the Beattrekkers DJ Battles that have been a huge success. I have met many people from different places on the planet. One main way is the Universal Greetings Project in the Community Building Decentraland discord. This started as a personal project but led to something bigger. I would take photos of my avatar and numerous different people throughout DCL and they would translate “Welcome to Decentraland” to a foreign language. Spanish, Portuguese, Italian, Greek, Arabic, Farsi, German, Norwegian, Finnish, Malay, Chinese, Japanese and more. I am also currently a part of a Rock Paper Scissors tournament event that will happen soon and next year be involved with an educational project and a Beattrekkers II.
motivation: To help make sure that all VP is being used to vote for important proposals whether they be a YES or NO. It will also give me a reason to talk with other community members about the various proposals put forth and learn more about the wants and needs of Decentraland.
vision: I hope there can be less conflict amongst the community. There is far too much and is not productive. I incorporated the Nteasee symbol in my first wearable design for a reason. The symbol comes from Ghana and represents a community coming together to resolve conflict. There is too much focus on the things that ultimately don’t matter and things that need to be fixed should be brought into the spotlight. There will come a time that there will no longer be a foundation and how we can continue to grow and succeed as a community together is what is needed.
most_important_issue: Interoperability has been another subject I hear much of, but little more than talked about. I would like to see efforts made towards this goal, if there are none already. There is a Metaverse Standards Forum that I would like to see DCL DAO work with to ensure we are not isolated. In the next 12 -24 months we could face more turmoil in the crypto community. Safeguarding the peoples assets should be a focus. Promoting Wallet safety. Scams on Open Sea continue to be an issue. Cyberbullying should be addressed. Who does one go to if they are bullied. 3rd parties will need to be brought in to handle many tasks. Marketing, Devs, etc. A.I and V.R will open up new methods that we have not even thought of yet. Lots to do. Let’s build a better world, together.

bio: My name is Tudamoon, been in DCL since March 2021. I have always been into freedom. Freedom is actually what got me into crypto in 2016. Love learning new things. Currently, I own and operate a skill games business in the US. I am in the start-up process of building an NFT rating platform for lenders. When it comes to policy, I am a firm believer of embracing as much as we can while keeping a fair system.
relevant_skills: My past experiences are what made me who I am today. I am going to share my experiences here because I believe in transparency and care about this space. I fear if we only give positive experiences, people will be too afraid to fail or be themselves, kind of what we see in the real world today. I have always been about freedom and rights. It took me down many rabbit holes. Became a paralegal through school, interned for the ACLU. Worked in civil litigation for a little while and considered becoming an attorney. I got discouraged when I found out you have more power by NOT being a licensed attorney. Then I moved into politics. Ran for local office and then ran for state office as a libertarian. Soon after, I got arrested for being argumentative with a police officer (was wrongly charged with a felony Assault on a Law enforcer). Did 6 days in jail to have my charge dropped because you can’t fight city hall. Nothing like being butt-naked and cupping your balls and coughing during a strip search. Oh yeah and jail food is for the birds. Jail was an interesting experience. Two things I learned from this are: to lose my ego (nature and the market don’t care) and that it is extremely hard to change a system. The best way to fix a broken system is to outcompete it with a better more improved system. In 2016, that’s what got me into crypto. My early crypto funds ended up getting seized on BTC-e, but I sure do miss reading the Troll Box. Learned the hard way: not your keys, not your crypto. Wrote a book on investing in crypto in 2018. Then in 2020, I got into the Skill Games industry in the US starting with $3k total and turned into a multi-million-dollar business in less than a year. Had 18 employees, grew too fast and I am still learning that lesson. Currently, while I am running that business, I am in the process of building an NFT rating platform for lenders. I feel these experiences are just as good as relevant skills because it makes me a more well-rounded voter in the DAO.
involvement: I have been using Decentraland since March 2021. I am mostly an end-user. I have created a few wearables and own a few land parcels. I am also really involved with the Holy Ones family.
motivation: Originally, I didn’t want to be a delegate. However after seeing some people throwing their VP around like candy, I want to be the force that promotes principles and ethics. I think it is needed in this space. I have seen greed take over people’s morals. I don’t believe people are bad, but I do think greed and fear get the best of us all at some point in time. My goal is to try to be level-headed in my decision-making and do what is best for the long-term for Decentraland.
vision: In 5 years, I want to see Decentraland filled with many things to do. I want a full moving economy. I think Decentraland should be a fairer system that embraces as many freedoms as possible.
most_important_issue: Infrastructural upgrades, End-User Experience, and changes in DAO Governance. We need to keep pushing forward.

bio: Hello, My name is Yasha, I’m the founder of a smart wearables startup called Gaian, and a digital studio called Trix. I’m also head of metaverse at Limewire.
involvement: I’ve worked with Decentraland on multiple occasions. First to unveil their movie theatre to screen a video I directed for Jim Jones and Migos “We Set The Trends” video, then to create a Limewire venue and Soulja Boy headlining performance for #MVMF22
motivation: I love DCL and want to help it succeed.
vision: I see DCL as the go-to for metaverse events, meetups. I see DCL as having fully integrated VR compatibility and being fully available on all Oculus devices and others. I would love to see more mainstream adoption. the DAO can help make that happen by funding the right projects.
most_important_issue: VR integration. Low active users, but this is an opportunity to build the infrastructure that will be needed during the next influx in daily users.

bio: I am Unai Da Silva from Spain, I am process engineer and project manager of Imagine to Create, a web3 project focus on creating a community of professionals, entrepreneurs and investors. I am the web3 environment since end of 2019 when I start studying about Bitcoin and Ethereum.
involvement: I am in Decentraland since May 2020 when I entered for the first time, I bought my name “Unai.dcl.eth” in september 2020 and I started to build, we started to develop Imagine to Create in Decentraland throught our Gallery, Galería Imagine that is in Vegas District (.124,85 and -121,91). I have helped hundreds of people to access decentraland through divulgation on twitter where I always have shown my dcl avatar in the profile and references to Decentraland in my name and I am admin of the telegram group in Spanish about decentraland with more users (760 at the time of writing this text). Together with other communities we have organized the first music festivals 100% in Spanish (Festiverse and CalaVerse), making decentraland known to high-calibre artists in the Latin world. Through Imagine to Create we have contributed to making this platform known among a multitude of companies in Spain since Imagine to Create has always had great activity through the art gallery and the objective is to continue growing in decentraland and helping the Hispanic community to break the language barrier and expand across decentraland.
motivation: I want to obtain voting power since I want to help promote projects that have the real capacity to take the platform to a new level in addition to bring new users to decentraland and new developments that improve the features of the platform making it the number one social network on the web 3. For example, I would like to support creators with disruptive ideas who want to develop their talent in decentraland through new applications or integrations with new technologies or new chains.
vision: I think Decentraland is much more than a virtual world for me it is the most advanced web3 community within the main community that is Ethereum. In it all kinds of entrepreneurs, creators, investors and players coexist and share their ideas, their visions and their projects. The philosophy about blockchain and decentralization that exists in decentraland is what attracts me the most and I believe the role of the DAO is to take care of that feeling and make it continue to flourish since the community that exists wants to voluntarily develop their professional careers around this platform. The grants program, the editor-SDK and the governance system are unique in my opinion in the ecosystem and could work as standards in the future for similar platforms. In the coming years I would like to see how new creators and new investors see Decentraland as the ideal metaverse prototype to create a community where power and wealth are decentralized. I would like to see the best talents and the hardest workers rewarded for their merits and recognized in the community revealing themselves as the future leaders of the web3
most_important_issue: I think that getting the new SDK7 to succeed and be used by the community is a great challenge, making it easier for new creators with little experience to build in decentraland without knowing how to code is a great idea and making it work and creativity flow could bring new ideas to the platform, new business models and new projects with new communities that could contribute to the economy of the platform. That is why I also believe that dclworlds has been a great idea, giving everyone more access to building experiences. I don’t think there is a user traffic problem, the problem for me is the hardware needs that users need to be able to navigate the world. Publishing a mobile app, even if it wasn’t the same experience as on the computer, would be key to reaching many more users and promoting new business models in decentraland. As I said before, I don’t think the important thing is to bring people to the virtual world, the important thing is to show the great community that exists, full of knowledge about decentralization and with a philosophy of collaboration and innovation that is unique not only in the blockchain community but also generally in the digital world.

bio: I consider myself as a professional with extensive experience in leading and coordinating teams, planning and project management. I have a very marked social sciences background, but I also have been involved in techonology and IT projects the last couple of years.
relevant_skills: Throughout my professional career, I have been able to interact and establish lasting and successful bonds with stakeholders from the private sector, civil society organizations, political groups, and public administration at all levels, to develop and implement projects and meet the needs of the organizations which I belonged to, managing to set expectations between all parts involved in a successful way. Since 2010, I have worked in +5 different areas from local governments and at the same time, actively collaborated with NGOs. During those years, I was involved in high scale projects and led different cross-functional teams in order to deliver the Buenos Aires 2018 Youth Olympic Games and most recently, led a task force for the Buenos Aires City Emergency Committee during the pandemic. I’m currently working as a Sr. Program Manager in a media/data analytics company, leading cross-functional teams from different countries and dealing with conflict resolution and intercultural communication every day to deliver results for different clients right on schedule.
involvement: I’ve been following this project from the outside since 2018, because I personally know some collaborators and land owners. A couple of months ago, I got more involved by collaborating with the SDK team to document specific architectural decisions and to bring more transparency through some posts in different platforms (‘SDK - Under the hood’), in order to disseminate technical information in an understandable way for everyone and get direct feedback from the community. Since December 22’, I’ve been fullfiling the role of Governance Facilitator within the DAO Facilitation Squad.
motivation: Addressing VP distribution. Transparency mechanisms between DAO-Foundation. Decission making process structure
vision: My 5-year vision is that Decentraland will consolidate as the main decentralized metaverse and also would expect a greater interoperability between DCL and other blockchain based platforms, such as other metaverses. I strongly believe that there will be an exponential and increased adoption of Decentraland from users with less technical knowledge about web3, and that developed and adopted technologies will continue to be a breakthough at a worldwide scale.
most_important_issue: VP distribution and the lack of incentives to participate and engage in votings and the decission making process.

bio: Hi all, I go by 1010(TenTen). I have been in Decentraland since late 2021. My involvement in DCL encompasses not just being an active user, but also building scenes for deployment(recreationally). I am also a multiple LAND/ESTATE owner currently running scenes on ALL of my estate, leaving none barren and only for investment.
relevant_skills: 8 years experience as a traditional retail investor
Owner of 18 plots of LAND (as of today)
motivation: My mandate as a delegate is to represent the interests of LAND/ESTATE owners. Too often than not, LAND owners’ representation has been under the radar/ignored. It has been more obvious with the drastic implementation of Worlds, without the consultation of its users/investors. I want to change that. My goal is simple, to vote in matters that affect LAND, both directly and indirectly, and to be the voice of reason. I intend to keep an open channel to all LAND owners via twtr/discord, so that I may represent them.
vision: Web2 has segregated us, and with that compartmentalization, placed us in echo chambers that only reinforce our own thinking. This has led us to our current state of affairs, a world divided with little sense of tolerance and not much exposure to other people’s worlds. In 5 years, I hope that Decentraland has achieved its goal of being optimal in user-friendliness. I also wish to see a bustling Genesis City, with users seamlessly participating in not just 1 but concurrent events that go on side by side, as is IRL. That way we are exposed to everyone’s interests, not just our own.
most_important_issue: The representation of different interests, from the creators, to the whales, to the LAND/WORLD/NAMES owners, all the way to the users. In a decentralized world, all who participate actively and contribute deserve a vote.

bio: Entrepreneur and blockchain enthusiast passionate about exploring the potential of Decentraland. I’m a creative thinker who enjoys building communities and developing new ideas to make the metaverse more accessible and engaging for all.
involvement: I’ve been involved with Decentraland for over a year now and have been active in the community as a builder, investor, and advocate. I’ve contributed to the development of several Decentraland projects and have been working closely with other community members to help grow the ecosystem.
motivation: I want to be a delegate because I believe in the potential of Decentraland and want to help shape its future. I believe that the DAO can be a powerful force for change in the ecosystem and want to be part of that change. As a delegate, I will work tirelessly to promote transparency, accountability, and community engagement within the DAO.
vision: In the next 5 years, I envision Decentraland as a thriving metaverse with a diverse and engaged community. I see a world where anyone can create, explore, and monetize their own unique experiences in Decentraland, and where the DAO plays a critical role in shaping the ecosystem and ensuring its long-term success.
most_important_issue: The most important issue in Decentraland right now is scalability. As more people join the platform and more content is created, the network will need to scale to meet the demand. This will require a concerted effort from the community and the DAO to find sustainable and scalable solutions. Additionally, I believe that community engagement and transparency are critical issues that the DAO must address in order to foster trust and build a strong, inclusive community.

bio: Greetings! I am a passionate 3D artist and content creator with a unique background, I was raised by Decentraland itself! I have honed my skills in creating and coding scenes for the Metaverse, and now I’m seeking your support. As a delegate, I will use my expertise to create exceptional experiences and contribute to the growth of DCL’s vibrant community. With a proven track record as a Twitch streamer. I am confident that I can help shape the future of the Metaverse. Join me on this exciting journey and let’s make DCL the best it can be!
involvement: As a Twitch streamer and content creator, I’ve had the opportunity to engage with the Decentraland community in a unique way. From showcasing my 3D art skills to creating immersive experiences for my viewers, I’ve always been passionate about sharing my love for DCL with others. During my time on Twitch, I had one of the fastest-growing channels in 2021, and although I may not have been the biggest, I had an incredible following that made the experience truly special. I onboarded and supported many known Decentraland creators, I used my platform to connect the right people with each other and gave my 100% to boost engagement for small projects. I did nearly 20.000+ giveaways manually back in the day and got many people their first 1.000 followers on Twitter, their first 400 members on Discord and help boosting their DCL sales.
motivation: Recently since end 2022 I also became familiar with the DCL DAO and have contributed my opinions ever since, at one point early in my DAO days I even got a grant for $10,000 but unfortunately I screwed up, Talking from experience I think its important to learn from mistakes and use it as experience for the future, I want to become a delegate to make sure your voting power is used in the right way.
vision: I am creating and working on a Project called Duel Arena, and in these upcoming 5 years I want to have this big project to represent Decentraland in the best way possible. I think that many more projects in DCL strive to represent Decentraland in this way so I believe that if we support the right projects with grants, and give the right parcels POI, make the right DAO decisions, only then Decentraland will become the biggest MetaVerse in 5 years from now.
most_important_issue: The biggest issue in Decentraland is people not understanding the concept of a Decentralized MetaVerse, people coming into this space think that they can't build and everything is done by some developers and 3D artists, but in the meanwhile, they don't realize how much there simplest idea can change the entire space.

bio: I am a crypto research analyst, working in a crypto investment fund with $10M AUM. Of course I have no access to that fund hahaha.
involvement: I own Decentraland estate 77,-101 and 77, -102. Lend it to the market but still own the 4k VP.
motivation: As investor, I want DCL to grow in terms of revenue stuff. Of course, this will be effective if we can spend the DAO budget properly and not for accelerating projects that has little to no impact to DCL. As an estate/landowner, I want the user experience to improve without sacrificing the core principle of the project. Although we can see the project improve with DCL editor and other stuff, having enough VP (from Delegation) can help builders to have a proper and honest vote. Using my expertise, I believe honest opinions can be raised, which will lead the DCL project towards its intended goal.
vision: My 5-year vision for Decentraland is it can host millions of users with a very low barrier of entry. This can be achieved if the DAO can decide a proper pathway, and NOT for temporary traffic.
most_important_issue: I believe the most important issue for DCL is the barrier of entry. The pain points in my perspective are: Users need to have a superb computer so that they can access our metaverse. Land utilization is low. Low adoption rate. User experience is good but needs to be competitive enough as more metaverse projects emerged. Decentraland (MANA) as security (US SEC). Decentralization health is questionable as the DAO and the Decentraland Foundation power is imbalanced.

bio: Its’a me, Morphbot - Focused on bringing interoperability and VR development ideas to the space. I believe whole-heartedly that DCL is about decentralization, and enabling the creator community via open source initiatives.
relevant_skills: Technical architecture consultation at double-digit Fortune companies
involvement: I properly dove in around 2021, when NFTs were heating up and I was looking into 3D asset ownership, I saw a need for 3D platforms/frameworks, and went out to create a 3D VTuber from assets purchased off the Ethereum marketplace. This journey brought me quite literally ‘across the metaverse’ and full circle to conclude DCL as the greatest customizable and open avatar platform that exists today, a spark that I’ve tried my best to push on to others, advocating for .VRM and interoperability for the ‘general metaverse’ ever since my first successful DCL avatar export w/ full face tracking and mouth/eye movement (~Feb/March 2022) Moving on from this technology, I seeked out .VRM compatible experiences, which drove me to my first VR hardware purchase since the Oculus DK1 - As the metaverse was a concept I’ve always loved, but never felt was really within reach - until now. It was only when I was finally able to put these ideas together, alongside with the original Decentraland vision built on top of JanusVR to one day be an interoperable, web-driven, VR world - that I truly began to understand what Decentraland would be.
motivation: There is too much toxic-positivity in the DAO hoping for grants to work out, many people without proof of concepts, or solid real world experience attempt to garner support for ideas that often can be invalidated before they even begin. I don’t believe the DAO exists to fund startups that are too risky, or too low quality to receive VC investment, and until opportunities that are of a certain quality arrive, we should protect the funds to our best diligence. Every DAO-printed mana that is sold is a tax to all DCL citizens, investors & users, many of whom have worked tirelessly to provide and contribute to the open source environment and DCL platform - we have a duty to protect the treasury from those that wish to pilfer it for their own income, with no viable plan or intention to help return value that outperforms the investment given.
vision: I see Decentraland as the backend of the metaverse, all of our clients (desktop/browser/VR) are merely interpretations of the DCL data and ecosystem for our users to connect. Through native technology and platform improvements, we live in a time where the original vision of DCL, being a browser-driven, VR, interoperable metaverse platform is possible - with the right planning and hiring of competent devs who have already built provable concepts implementing these ideas, we can push forward the native metaverse: DCL characters in every game that wishes to implement them, kicking off a wave of personalized VR avatars that causes a flourishing of market activity both for the DAO and the platforms creators, enabling shapekey & jiggle bones improvements to bring the market place to a competitive level. Users interoperably jumping between worlds of various platforms in their VR headset alongside friends, increasing the value of DCL overworld & platform, acting as a place to centralize logic for seamless exploration between even different metaverses! Don’t you wish you could wave your arms around, or talk/hangout with your friends while the actual avatar mouth moves from voice chat, with your eyes/head movement based on where you’re looking and facial micro expressions that make it feel like you are actually IN Decentraland and physically spending time with people?
most_important_issue: I believe the DAO simply lacks direction on what the optimal use of funds could be, or what to do with funds during a bearmarket while we lack that direction, we need to have larger conversations about how the DAO can enforce a certain level of impact to ensure grants benefit all DCL users at large. Given that VR has been removed from the foundation roadmap, it becomes clear that we as a DAO must figure out a legitimate path towards VR implementations within our platform, not just at the interface level, but by supporting native VR interfaces at the platform level that any developers can connect to (such as WebXR). This concept would not only add great value to our platform, it would unlock a massive number of business use cases and improvements for all metaverse native businesses. What challenges will we face in the next 12 to 24 months? The bear market has been rough, after a 90% slide-down in mana it is clear there is a growing concern of what the future holds. I want to be clear, this is normal procedure in crypto, and while we may want to prepare ourselves for future cycles, we must be very careful about acting rash in a time of such negative average price disparity. What we can do, is rally together, cut spending, and unify on ideas that will multiply the value of the DCL platform for all involved - That’s why I’m here, even though I hate politics and would much rather be working on my avatar ecosystem.

bio: Decentraland Verified Partner and founder of the DCL Brasil community.
involvement: I’ve been a Decentraland citizen since 2021. Since then I released several wearables, founded the DCL Brasil community, thrown lots of events and connected/onboarded lots of users
motivation: The community has voiced their wish to delegate me recently, so I’m just formalizing the request
vision: Stronger and active communities
most_important_issue: I believe our biggest priority is to improve software performance. Also onboarding and engaging new and old users

bio: I’m experienced marketing specialist, content creator, 3D/VR educator and currently serves in the Strategic Relations role for the Decentraland DAO Facilitation Squad. I have over 15 years of experience teaching Digital arts in visual art centers and have worked as an educator with various STEM programs for over 10 years
involvement: In early 2021, I joined Decentraland and fell in love with the creative possibilities and community. As an art curator, event coordinator, and member of the DCL Reporter crew, I interviewed creators and builders and did tutorials for a year. I also participated in a tier 6 grant with IRL Art as a builder, wearable creator, and event coordinator. For the past year, I’ve been a member of the Decentraland DAO facilitation squad with a Strategic Comms focus. Additionally, I’m honored to be one of the artists invited to the upcoming Beta Launch of the MESH art show. As a builder and creator at heart, I’m dedicated to serving and supporting the community
motivation: I love creativity, learning, collaboration and building. Those are all the things that originally led me down the rabbit hole to Decentraland and those are the reasons driving me wanting to be a delegate. Since the first day I entered Decentraland I have been fascinated and inspired by the community of builders working diligently to make the amazing experiences and builds in Decentraland. I have built and been a part of various grants, learned from many different creators, interviewed and hosted countless events and for the past year I have been serving the community as a member of the Facilitation Squad. I want to help be a positive voice for the builders and creators and feel that all that I have contributed to DCL so far has really given me a good understanding of the heart of this community. I would love the opportunity to help that amazing heart grow
vision: I see it as the central hub of collaboration and creativity across all Metaverses. It will continue to grow and become known as the playground for innovative experiences. Educators, students, brands, entrepreneurs , universities, business incubators creators will cross-polinnate and build together. Since I started as a DAO facilitator, I’ve been serving the community and attempting to share the light and innovation in this community. I want to continue to build pathways for that story to be told to the community and to all others. I want to see more collaboration and less destructive behavior. I hope to promote that and hope that this simple idea of sharing the positive, will help light a pathway to that positive collaboration
most_important_issue: One of the most important/challenging issues is with VP distribution and the lack of incentives to participate and engage in votings and the decision-making process. I don’t really see challenges as challenges but as opportunities. I don’t see we have competitors I think we have amazing opportunities for collaborations. I think growth and onboarding which are seen as challenges will be where we see the most innovation and creativity

bio: Retail manufacturer, with points of sale in Spain for more than 15 years and online sales in other countries. I’ve been in Web2 business since 2010, crypto investor since 2015. DCL verified creator and have developed several wearables and VRMs for other virtual worlds.
involvement: I joined DCL in November 2022, attracted by the customization that the platform allows and its great potential, I saw that this was a great moment to establish myself as a creator and begin to build a long-term commitment to this community, almost a year later I am still enjoying this platform, I have made good friends and I think the most exciting thing is yet to come. Over the last few months I have felt great interest in the governance processes of Decentraland, coming to realize the enormous importance of the involvement of us (the users) in the voting. As a relatively new user in Decentraland I can see very closely the reasons why I entered and why I would not have done so, I think that having entered Decentraland in a bear market gives me a fairly objective view of the reasons why many users are not logging into the platform right now, and I would love to change this.
motivation: For almost a year I have been trying to find my place in the community, I believe that being a delegate would be a great step forward for my involvement in the community and in Decentraland’s governance processes. Another reason why I think I should run as a delegate is because I have full availability to dedicate myself to DAO affairs and I really want to start seriously with this. I am also concerned that Decentraland is having serious problems attracting new users and I firmly believe that this problem is the first one we need to solve. At the same time, I do not think that being in a bear market serves as a justification, I think that if we enhance certain aspects of the platform we will significantly increase the number of users.
vision: I would like to see how we work together to turn Decentraland into a fully populated place, not just for a few hours and in a few scenes, but in any area* throughout the day *, I don’t think it will be something difficult to achieve, the way just hasn’t been found yet. I believe that the DAO is a very powerful instrument that is being used as a game, good governance can make Decentralnd become an attractive place for new users, but misused it can cause the platform to collapse.
most_important_issue: The most important thing, (and this is something I’m completely convinced of) is to attract new users to the platform as soon as possible. The DAO funds are not infinite and are being used for matters I don’t consider a priority. I believe there are many projects that hold significant value but could wait. I also see few proposals aimed at paving the way for new users and creators. I am convinced that if the platform is user-friendly and appealing to everyone, people will start joining, regardless of whether it’s a bear or bull market. I also understand other secondary issues that are indirectly affecting the entry of new users, and of course, there are many areas for improvement that do not have a direct relation to attracting more people to Decentraland. However, I believe they should take a back seat until we solve the main problem.
